info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 7 at 9:06AM CDT until June 8 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Chikaskia River near Blackwell affecting Grant and Kay Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Chikaskia River near Blackwell.
* WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Low-lying streets in the northeast portions of Blackwell may flood enough to isolate some small areas near the river. Rural areas and local roads in extreme northeastern Grant and Kay counties are under shallow water depths for a few hours. Southeast of Blackwell... Hubbard Road will be briefly covered by shallow depths of water near the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 28.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The Chikaskia River is expected to fall. - Action stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING
